main.name: Archita Singh
main.description: Turing Scholar | CS + Math @ UT Austin
main.bio: Hello! My name is Archita Singh, and I am studying Computer Science and Mathematics at the University of Texas at Austin.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

education.degree: B.S. Computer Science, Turing Scholar Honors
education.description: Activities: Directed Reading Program, WiCS, MaGiCS

work.title: Academy for Mathematics and Programming
description: 1 of 78 out of 5000+ selected nationally for five-week residential/educational program taught by U.S. Math Team coaches and IMO medalists
Designed, implemented, and presented Python artificial intelligence agents for mathematically-focused games, such as Wordle and Anagrams, with a focus on rigorous testing and creative problem solving
Completed rigorous coursework in number theory, combinatorics, and computer science, spanning topics such as probability, statistics, object-oriented design, algorithms, and game theory

work.title: Data Science & ML Research Intern
description: Processed 50+ records of demographic and health data using MySQL to develop clustering models in Python (SciKit-Learn).
Applied the Elbow Method with K-means clustering, and principal component analysis to isolate key features
Presented research at Rice University's Ken Kennedy AI and Data Science Conference.

work.title: Academic Research Intern
description: Utilized automated video scanning, indexing, captioning, and search to make lecture videos interactive learning resources.
Used Pandas, Scikit-Learn, Natural Language Processing, and Google Tesseract to develop keyword identification algorithms and metrics to evaluate performance against groundtruth keywords

projects.title: Electronic Trading Competition Bot
projects.category: Developed quantitative modeling and trading algorithms on electronically simulated stock exchanges. Traded on simulated market, produced the 3rd highest PNL over 6 hours of market making

projects.title: CamelUp
projects.category: Developed backend and unit tests for a digital version of CamelUp with a focus on object-oriented design. Developed an artificial intelligence agent to mathematically optimize bets based on the current board state.

projects.title: COVID-19 Comorbidity Analysis
projects.category: Determined demographic and comorbidity features correlated to COVID cases/deaths in Python and SciKit-Learn. Used principal component analysis to narrow down 4 most influential features. Implemented the Elbow Method with K-means clustering models, varying the number of clusters and features. Presented research at the Ken Kennedy AI and Data Science Conference

projects.title: Comparison of Key Word Identification Models
projects.category: Utilizes automatic video indexing, captioning, and search within and across recordings to transform a classroom lecture video into an interactive learning resource. Working on the implementation of document scanning to search through supplementary materials and lecture keyword identification.
